Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2013 07:35PM antonia1 wrote: My onc. does blood work, including markers every 6 months, now. I only get scans if I have a specific complaint, and even then refers me first to a specialist.
Posts.Title: what screening after chemo and rads? Romanticrose LindaLou53

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2011 01:25PM antonia1 wrote: I got shingles a week ago, Saturday, on the side of my hand, the 'wrong' hand at that. At first I thought it was an allergic reaction to something I had touched, but on Monday my MO said it looked like shingles. I had shingles before, but not on my hand. It is not really painful but very, very inconvenient -- I had to postponed Heceptin until Monday and next week I am scheduled for the exchange. Can I still go ahead with it? I will have to call my PS. Worse yet, since it is not painful,  I don't really know  when exactly it all started, and since the rash/blisters are in a very exposed, but not immediately visible place, how many people could I have infected, including my baby grandson?  I am so angry that I did not get shingles vaccine before my chemo, never knew it existed.  Or well, now that I got it all out of my system, I am feeling better.
Posts.Title: Shingles >:-( lago Teka

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2011 02:06PM antonia1 wrote: My MO put me on Famciclovir, so i hope it will help. My previous case of shingles was relatively mild so I hope this time will be the same. I will call my PS tomorrow and let him know about shingles.  The blisters are not at the drying up stage, yet, so i am going around wearing one glove.  Hope it protects those around me.   Yesterday I saw my RO and the cardiologist for a follow up check ups and they were totally incurious until i told them why I was wearing one glove. Neither one seemed overly concerned about the possibility that i may be infectious.
Posts.Title: Shingles >:-( lago Teka

I like her attitude.  On the other hand, it is not entirely easy to follow that advise.

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2012 07:47PM antonia1 wrote:  I had surgery first, followed by 4 AC followed by 12 Taxol plus Herceptin, Herceptin to continue for a year, followed by radiation and AI. I wish I had neoadjuvant treatment. At least I would know if the chemo worked. The MRI and Pet scans performed after core biopsy showed 2cm tumor and not the actual 4+cm, so the surgeon decided on immediate  surgery. Interesting thing is that when I contacted oncologist's office at SKCC for consultation, they told me that they set up  appointments only  AFTER breast surgery and not before, without even knowing the size of the tumor.
